text:
Having a custom tag where a regular (rtexprvalue=false) attribute is defined to 
be a char or java.lang.Character (e.g. <myTag myChar="a"/>) results in the 
following error.

java.lang.NumberFormatException: Cannot extract a char from a zero length array
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.TagBeginGenerator.convertString
(TagBeginGenerator.java:268)
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.TagBeginGenerator.generateSetters
(TagBeginGenerator.java:229)
	at 
org.apache.jasper.compiler.TagBeginGenerator.generateServiceMethodStatements
(TagBeginGenerator.java:332)
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.TagBeginGenerator.generate
(TagBeginGenerator.java:395)

creator: simon_g_brown@yahoo.com
text:
Line 263 of TagBeginGenerator.java contains the following check, which I think 
is the source of the problem.

"if (s.length() > 1) {"

This should really be :

"if (s.length() > 0) {"
